docs.lead_paragraph: Congressional Republicans are divided over how to respond to an approaching Supreme Court decision on President Barack Obama's health care law, even as growing numbers concede that their long-sought goal of repealing the statute will have to wait.

headline.main: GOP Divided as Supreme Court Ruling on Health Care Law Nears
headline.print_headline: GOP Divided as Supreme Court Ruling on Health Care Law Nears

docs.lead_paragraph: State lawmakers rejected efforts to expand the state Medicaid program to give the working poor government-funded health insurance, the third year of defeats for the legislation.

headline.main: Louisiana: Lawmakers Refuse to Add More Working Poor to Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Louisiana: Lawmakers Refuse to Add More Working Poor to Medicaid

docs.abstract: Louisiana lawmakers vote against attempts to expand state Medicaid program to give working poor government-funded health insurance, third year of defeats for legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two reports say that failure to follow provisions of the Affordable Care Act had left some women with significant cost barriers to birth control.

headline.main: Insurers Flout Rule Covering Birth Control, Studies Find
headline.print_headline: Insurers Flout Rule Covering Birth Control, Studies Find

docs.abstract: Reports by National Women's Law Center and Kaiser Family Foundation find health insurance companies often flout requirement of Affordable Care Act that they cover all approved methods of birth control for women without co-payments or other charges.
docs.snippet: Two reports say that failure to follow provisions of the Affordable Care Act had left some women with significant cost barriers to birth control.

docs.lead_paragraph: A woman who was the victim of a Jamaican lottery scam told a federal jury Wednesday that she received a postcard in June 2012 at her Madison, South Dakota, home from a company called American Cash Awards asking for $10 to enter a sweepstakes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Several of the nation's biggest health insurers have hiked earnings expectations for 2015 after blowing past first-quarter forecasts and heading into a much more stable future than they faced this time last year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans unveiled the first joint House-Senate budget plan in six years on Wednesday, aiming to boost defense spending, eliminate deficits by 2024 and ease a repeal of  President Barack Obama's signature health care reform law.

headline.main: In the Midst of Tragedy, Creating an Album as a Form of Therapy

docs.abstract: The folk duo Brown Bird’s final release, “Axis Mundi,” was recorded just before — and finished just after — the singer-songwriter David Lamb’s death from leukemia.
docs.snippet: The folk duo Brown Bird’s final release, “Axis Mundi,” was recorded just before — and finished just after — the singer-songwriter David Lamb’s death from leukemia.

headline.main: The Right Paperwork for Your End-of-Life Wishes

docs.abstract: Once the patient has been lifted onto the conveyor belt of life support, it can be very hard to take him off. A Polst form can help.
